definition: in criminal law, a pleading describing some wrong or offense
details:
noun
- in criminal law, a pleading describing some wrong or offense
= example: in criminal law, a pleading describing some wrong or offense
= synonyms: charge
- (civil law) the first pleading of the plaintiff setting out the facts on which the claim for relief is based
- an expression of grievance or resentment
- (formerly) a loud cry (or repeated cries) of pain or rage or sorrow
- an often persistent bodily disorder or disease
= synonyms: ailment, ill
